channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: GCSEs: Exams 'definitely' have place in Wales' future
item.description: The head of the qualifications watchdog says pupils would be "let down" if they were scrapped.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Veterans reflect on troops leaving country
item.description: The two veterans have opposing views on whether the conflict has had a positive effect.

item.title: Georgia shipwreck: Welsh kit to help Golden Ray clean-up
item.description: About a million gallons of contaminated mud needs to be treated from the remains of the ship.

item.title: Trellyffaint: Proof unearthed of Neolithic dairy farming in Pembrokeshire
item.description: Shards of decorated pottery containing traces of dairy fat residue have been dated to 3,100BC.

item.title: Mumbles: Boy, 12, in hospital after open-top bus crash
item.description: Several other people also sustained minor injuries after the sight-seeing bus crashed.

item.title: Cardiff: Three in court charged with Bute Park murder
item.description: Dr Gary Jenkins died 16 days after he was attacked in the city centre park on 20 July.

item.title: Covid: Tories accuse Starmer of hypocrisy over travel tests
item.description: He is accused of ignoring Welsh Labour ministers' insistence that travellers use higher-cost tests.

item.title: Greece fires: Welsh firefighters help battle wildfires
item.description: The UK's 21-strong team includes four Welsh firefighters, who are unsure when they will return home.

item.title: Kirsty Williams: Abuse of women in politics getting worse
item.description: Kirsty Williams says she could not keep her family safe from trolling while Welsh education minister.

item.title: Climate change: Fisherman stops farming mussels due to hot weather
item.description: A shellfish farmer says its no longer viable to continue farming mussels due to warmer temperatures.

item.title: Wales plan for capacity autumn series crowds
item.description: The WRU will offer full refunds if Covid-19 disrupts plans for capacity crowds when Wales face New Zealand, South Africa, Fiji and Australia in the autumn.

item.title: Greece wildfires: 12-hour days for Welsh firefighter
item.description: The UK's 21-strong team includes four Welsh firefighters, who are unsure when they will return home.

item.title: Trolling of women in politics 'worrying'
item.description: Kirsty Williams said she had felt unable to keep her family safe from the trolling on social media.

item.title: Wales: Post-lockdown demand on ambulance staff 'relentless'
item.description: Paramedics and control room staff share their stories as pressure on services rises.

item.title: Lauren Price: Olympic boxer overwhelmed by 'insane' reception
item.description: The Welsh boxing champion was given a hero's welcome on her return to Ystrad Mynach.

item.title: A-levels 2021 in Wales: Pupils celebrate after tough year
item.description: Pupils receive their A-level results after a mix of online and in-person learning.

item.title: Rhyl cancer patient Ann Jones: 'There should have been more done'
item.description: A woman criticises the care her late mother received following the publication of a watchdog's report.

item.title: Carabao Cup: Newport face Southampton, Cardiff host Brighton and Swansea meet Plymouth
item.description: Newport County will host Southampton in round two of the Carabao Cup, while Cardiff City meet Brighton and Swansea City host Plymouth.

item.title: The Hundred: Brave go top of the table, Fire crash out
item.description: Southern Brave cruise to a comfortable win over Welsh Fire which takes them to the top of the table.

item.title: No away fans allowed at September's European internationals because of 'spike' in Covid cases
item.description: No away fans will be permitted at next month's international matches in Europe because of a "spike"in Covid-19 cases, Uefa and Fifa confirm.

item.title: Lauren Price: Tokyo Olympics boxing champion reveals approach from promoter Eddie Hearn
item.description: Olympic boxing champion Lauren Price reveals promoter Eddie Hearn has contacted her about the prospect of turning professional.

item.title: David Probert: Welsh jockey rides five straight winners at Ffos Las
item.description: Welsh jockey David Probert rides five successive winners at Ffos Las.

item.title: 'Angen i arholiadau barhau'n rhan o'r drefn asesu'
item.description: Ar ddiwrnod cyhoeddi canlyniadau TGAU, cadeirydd Cymwysterau Cymru yn dweud bod angen arholiadau.

item.title: Galw am 'adfer democratiaeth' Ceredigion wedi'r cyfyngiadau
item.description: Gwrthblaid yn dweud bod angen i Gyngor Ceredigion fynd 'nôl i'r drefn arferol o reoli yn sgil llacio cyfyngiadau.

item.title: 'Bywyd syml Ynys Enlli yn denu mwy o bobl'
item.description: Does yna ddim dŵr cynnes, trydan, cawod na Wi-Fi ar Ynys Enlli, ond mae'r bywyd syml "yn dod yn fwy poblogaidd".

item.title: Llion Williams: Lloches ar ynysoedd yr Alban
item.description: Yr actor sy'n egluro pam ei fod yn byw yn yr Alban am gyfnod a'i rybuddion i Gymru o'r Ynys Hir.

item.title: Tri chlwb Cymru trwodd i ail rownd Cwpan yr EFL
item.description: Caerdydd yn trechu Sutton United, Abertawe yn fuddugol yn Reading a Chasnewydd yn ennill yn Ipswich.
